poem:
**Piano Entwined**

In the dance of keys,  
arms cross, not with fervor,  
but with the quiet grace  
of tender intimacy.  
Notes spill gently  
from fingers entwined,  
a melody of shared breath,  
soft as whispering winds.  
No need for vows—  
in this duet,  
the heart finds   
its own reverie.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Leif Ove Andsnes and Bertrand Chamayou review – rewarding pairing brings intimacy and colour Until Márta Kurtág’s death in 2019, one of the most delightful musical experiences was to watch and listen to her and her composer husband György playing his piano duets – the playfulness, the quiet intimacy, the way in which the writing meant they crossed arms as if in a gentle game of Twister. But you don’t have to be married to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
